SENT.plain: The black Caribbean population continues to grow in the US and little is known about stroke etiologies in that community
We examined stroke subtypes in 175 consecutive Haitian-born patients living in Miami, admitted for acute stroke
Small vessel occlusion was the most frequent stroke subtype
There was a high prevalence of hypertension, medication noncompliance and intracranial atherosclerosis
Hypertension was the only cardiovascular risk factor significantly associated with small vessel infarction when compared with non-small vessel infarcts
